Blog.post: Good news! I passed the School of Accountancy. I found out Friday at 10:00am at work. Noboby else was at work though because we had our Sports Day on Thursday and everyone took Friday off. Sports day was pretty fun. We played three games of baseball and three of volleyball. My baseball team won every game and were the champs, hooray! Boy was I sore on Friday, I actually had to lift my own legs into the car driving to work Friday morning. Friday night Rachelle and I headed to London for some partying. We went to the beach on Lake Erie Saturday with Tim, Wendy and Greg. It wasn't spectacular, but we had a good time. Tim and Wendy had a fantastic barbecue back at their place where we were joined by Chris, Jenn and Kyle. Afterwards we got into the bubbly and the sparkly and the brown stuff and headed to the bar. This was one of the few occasions in London that we didn't end up going to Molly Blooms - I think we went to T.Js or something like that. It was a good time, but after the bar we were walking over to Molly Blooms where Greg and Chris had taken off to. On our way we ran into Greg who had just been kicked out of Molly Blooms for puking -hahaha. As we were walking a train was comming and in our drunken stupour, we decided to run and beat it. When I was crossing the tracks I remember looking up and the train was about 40ft from me - man was that stupid!!! Anyway, I learned something from that - don't be retarded, be cool stay in school!

Last weekend we went up to maskoka to Stacey's cottage. It was unbeleivable, now I know how the wealthy live. If you think of a really nice cottage, their boat house was better than that! It was a mansion on the lake basically and furnished as one. There were five bedrooms and each one had its own bathroom. Even the boat house had a kitchen and bathroom in it. They had all the toys too, two sea-doos, two power boats with tubing and wake boarding. It was fantastic - and the weather was amazing. I had never been tubing before but it got my adrenaline going. Stacey's whole purpose was to make me fly off, but I held on for my life. There was another couple up for the weekend too, Henry and his gal. We all jumped off the top of the boat house (they had a patio up there with a door that swung open). The water was apparently 20ft deep there so it was safe. I got a few brews in me and decided to do a front flip off the boathouse, which was about 20ft up from the water. I thought to myself, I don't want to over flip and land on my face because that would hurt like a mofo. So I ended up under flipping and landed flat on my back from 20ft up! Did that ever hurt like a mofo! What a fun weekend, I hope Stacey invites us up again! My arms are still hurting though from hanging onto the tube! Oh, check out this story on Ken Jennings called The Summer of Jeopardy Guy. It is pretty funny. urlLink http://sports.espn.go.com/espn/page2/story?page=simmons/040721 Cheers, Carter

I woke up this morning tired and groggy just like everyday and managed to stumble into the shower. I heard the phone ring just as I turned on the water but figured Rachelle could rollover and answer it easier than me making a mad dash out of the bathroom, and a wet mess to clean up. I thought to myself - who would be calling this early? It must be either mom wanting to meet for lunch or something bad has happened. I had that sick feeling that something was wrong and immediately thought of dad. It has been in the back of my mind for two or three years now, that dad is getting older, still smokes and is a big man. Sometimes I wonder how dad gets through life after the loss of his father - it was devastating even for me and I have no idea how I would be able to manage without my pop around. After I got out of the shower I asked Rachelle who phoned and she said mom. I felt a little better because if something was wrong mom probably would say something to Rachelle. I called mom back after I got dressed and had some orange juice to see if she wanted to meet for lunch, but the news was bad - dad had a heart attack about 2am and mom had taken him to emergency. She said he was scheduled to see the specialist around 9:00 and was doing ok. I kept my composure on the phone with mom, but when I hung up I lost it. After a few momments I went to tell Rachelle who was still in bed and wept on her shoulder before going to the hospital. When I arrived he was in the ICU and hooked up to a bunch of wires and machines. He had an ultrasound done and they don't think any damage has occured. He is hopefully going to Kingston tomorrow for more testing. It was really tough seeing him with all the wires attached. You grow up thinking your dad is superman and it is devastating when you realize he is mortal. Hopefully everything turns around and he quits smoking and becomes more active again. I am praying it is just a blessing in disguise.
